alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL DE BACA, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 430 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Puerto De Luna, or 16 miles southeast of Santa Rosa, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Puerto De Luna. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 283 and 289. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Quay County
